00035 
00036 static void
00037 usage(const char *progname)
00038 {
00039     fprintf(stderr,
00040             "Usage:\n"
00041             "   %s [-h] [-d] [-v] [-t <lifetime>] (-f <configfile> | COMMAND)\n"
00042             "       -h print usage and exit\n"
00043             "       -d enter dynamic mode and create FIB entries based on DNS SRV records\n"
00044             "       -f <configfile> add or delete FIB entries based on the content of <configfile>\n"
00045             "       -t use value in seconds for lifetime of prefix registration\n"
00046             "       -v increase logging level\n"
00047             "\n"
00048             "   COMMAND can be one of following:\n"
00049             "       (add|del) <uri> (udp|tcp) <host> [<port> [<flags> [<mcastttl> [<mcastif>]]]])\n"
00050             "           to add prefix to or delete prefix from face identified by parameters\n"
00051             "       (add|del) <uri> face <faceid>\n"
00052             "           to add prefix to or delete prefix from face identified by number\n"
00053             "       (create|destroy) (udp|tcp) <host> [<port> [<mcastttl> [<mcastif>]]])\n"
00054             "           create or destroy a face identified by parameters\n"
00055             "       destroy face <faceid>\n"
00056             "           destroy face identified by number\n"
00057             "       srv\n"
00058             "           add ccnx:/ prefix to face created from parameters in SRV\n"
00059             "           record of a domain in DNS search list\n"
00060             ,
00061             progname);
00062 }
00063 
00064 char *
00065 create_command_from_command_line(int argc, char **argv)
00066 {
00067     int len = 0;
00068     char *out = NULL;
00069     int i;
00070     
00071     if (argc == 0)
00072         return NULL;
00073     
00074     for (i = 0; i < argc; i++) {
00075         len += strlen(argv[i]) + 1;
00076     }
00077     
00078     out = calloc(len, sizeof(char));
00079     if (out == 0) {
00080         ccndc_fatal(__LINE__, "Cannot allocate memory\n");
00081     }
00082     
00083     len = 0;
00084     for (i = 0; i < argc; i++) {
00085         memcpy(out+len, argv[i], strlen(argv[i]));
00086         len += strlen(argv[i]) + 1;
00087         out[len-1] = ' '; // separate everything with one space
00088     }
00089     out[len-1] = 0;
00090     
00091     return out;
00092 }

00095 
00096 int
00097 main(int argc, char **argv)
00098 {
00099     struct ccndc_data *ccndc = NULL;
00100     const char *progname = NULL;
00101     const char *configfile = NULL;
00102     int res = 1;
00103     int opt, disp_res;
00104     char *cmd = NULL;
00105     int dynamic = 0;
00106     int lifetime = -1;
00107     
00108     progname = argv[0];
00109     
00110     while ((opt = getopt(argc, argv, "hdvt:f:")) != -1) {
00111         switch (opt) {
00112             case 'f':
00113                 configfile = optarg;
00114                 break;
00115             case 't':
00116                 lifetime = atoi(optarg);
00117                 if (lifetime <= 0) {
00118                     usage(progname);
00119                     goto Cleanup;
00120                 }
00121                 break;
00122             case 'v':
00123                 verbose = 1;
00124                 break;
00125             case 'd':
00126                 dynamic = 1;
00127                 break;
00128             case 'h':
00129             default:
00130                 usage(progname);
00131                 goto Cleanup;
00132         }
00133     }
00134     
00135     if (configfile == NULL && !dynamic && optind == argc) {
00136         usage(progname);
00137         goto Cleanup;
00138     }
00139     
00140     ccndc = ccndc_initialize_data();
00141     if (lifetime > 0)
00142         ccndc->lifetime = lifetime;
00143     if (optind < argc) {
00144         /* config file cannot be combined with command line */
00145         if (configfile != NULL) {
00146             ccndc_warn(__LINE__, "Config file cannot be combined with command line\n");
00147             usage(progname);
00148             goto Cleanup;
00149         }
00150         
00151         if (argc - optind < 0) {
00152             usage(progname);
00153             goto Cleanup;
00154         }
00155         
00156         cmd = create_command_from_command_line(argc-optind-1, &argv[optind+1]);
00157         disp_res = ccndc_dispatch_cmd(ccndc, 0, argv[optind], cmd, argc - optind - 1);
00158         free(cmd);
00159         if (disp_res == INT_MIN) {
00160             usage(progname);
00161             goto Cleanup;
00162         }
00163     }
00164     if (configfile) {
00165         read_configfile(ccndc, configfile);
00166     }
00167     if (dynamic) {
00168         ccndc_daemonize(ccndc);
00169     }
00170     res = 0;
00171 Cleanup:
00172     ccndc_destroy_data(&ccndc);
00173     return res;
00174 }
00175 
00176 /**
00177  * @brief Process configuration file
00178  * @param filename
00179  *
00180  * Processing configuration file in two rounds. First round performs a dry run
00181  * to check for errors.  If no erors found, commands are executing if normal mode.
00182  */
00183 static int
00184 read_configfile(struct ccndc_data *ccndc, const char *filename)
00185 {
00186     int configerrors;
00187     int lineno;
00188     
00189     FILE *cfg;
00190     char buf[1024];
00191     char *cp = NULL;
00192     char *cmd, *rest_of_the_command;
00193     int res;
00194     int phase;
00195     int retcode;
00196     int len;
00197     
00198     for (phase = 1; phase >= 0; --phase) {
00199         configerrors = 0;
00200         retcode = 0;
00201         lineno = 0;
00202         cfg = fopen(filename, "r");
00203         if (cfg == NULL)
00204             ccndc_fatal(__LINE__, "%s (%s)\n", strerror(errno), filename);
00205         
00206         while (fgets((char *)buf, sizeof(buf), cfg)) {
00207             lineno++;
00208             len = strlen(buf);
00209             if (buf[0] == '#' || len == 0)
00210                 continue;
00211             if (buf[len - 1] == '\n')
00212                 buf[len - 1] = '\0';
00213             cp = index(buf, '#');
00214             if (cp != NULL)
00215                 *cp = '\0';
00216             
00217             rest_of_the_command = buf;
00218             do {
00219                 cmd = strsep(&rest_of_the_command, " \t");
00220             } while (cmd != NULL && cmd[0] == 0);
00221             
00222             if (cmd == NULL) /* blank line */
00223                 continue;
00224             res = ccndc_dispatch_cmd(ccndc, phase, cmd, rest_of_the_command, -1);
00225             retcode += res;
00226             if (phase == 1 && res < 0) {
00227                 ccndc_warn(__LINE__, "Error: near line %d\n", lineno);
00228                 configerrors++;
00229             }
00230         }
00231         fclose(cfg);
00232         if (configerrors != 0)
00233             return (-configerrors);
00234     } 
00235     return (retcode);
00236 }
